title: Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead Help
content:
I built a new pc and have been building rigs since I was about 17. I'm now 43. My problem is I can no longer use Firefox which has always been my favorite browser since it was released. My pc is a gaming rig with a NVMe M.2 SSD for the hard drive and all the other bells and whistles and is brand spanking new. All drivers up to date and hardware in perfect working order. Hardly any apps just mostly games.

Firefox worked fine for a few days now all I get on any site even YouTube, eBay, or Amazon it does not matter all I get is this error:

Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead

Firefox detected a potential security threat and did not continue to www.ebay.com. If you visit this site, attackers could try to steal information like your passwords, emails, or credit card details.

What can you do about it?

The issue is most likely with the website, and there is nothing you can do to resolve it.

If you are on a corporate network or using anti-virus software, you can reach out to the support teams for assistance. You can also notify the website’s administrator about the problem.

I have a fresh install of windows 10 Home Version 21H1 and I only use windows defender as virus software. All other browsers work just fine. I have searched the internet high and low for a fix, nothing works. YouTube advice, Google advice, uninstall, reinstall. I reset my router and updated the firmware. Dressed up like a red Fox. I'm stumped. I don't want to just bypass it as I don't feel safe doing it that way and it sucks having to do it over and over. I'm forced to use Microsoft Edge. I've tried everything I can think of to fix this.

Please help! Thanks, Chad
creator: oldlords79

title: Problem with FF version 95.0 update
content:
Running Win 7 Pro. In my previous version of FF (94.0.2), I have modified the UserChrome.css file (s suggested by others on this forum) to provide a scroll bar for my bookmarks. This has worked well for for all subsequent FF updates, until the latest update (95.0), which has forced me to create a new profile.

Now, the bookmarks still have a scroll bar, but as soon as I put my mouse pointer anywhere on the list, the bookmarks automatically start rapidly scrolling all the way to the end, making it impossible for me to select any particular bookmark.

I have tried to replace the new profile with my old one, but version 95.0 will not accept that. I have also tried to replace the UserChrome.css file with the old one, but that doesn't fix the problem.

Is this a bug in the new version, or is the an edit I can do to the UserChrome.css file that would fix this? Here is what I currently have in the UserChrome.css file: 

     /* Firefox userChrome.css */

@namespace url("http://www.mozilla.org/keymaster/gatekeeper/there.is.only.xul");

toolbarbutton[part="scrollbutton-up"], toolbarbutton[part="scrollbutton-down"] { 

 display: none !important;

} scrollbox[part="scrollbox"] { 

 overflow: auto !important;

}

For now, I have reinstalled version 94.0.2.

Thank you.

title: Caricamento anomalo
content: Salve a tutti, da circa una settimana ho gravi problemi nel caricamento del sito: https://www.intesasanpaolo.com/ ovvero il sito in primis si carica bene, i problemi insorgono quando faccio l'accesso nell'area riservata. Tutto diventa estremamente lento, una cosa mai vista prima tanto che è meglio non rischiare di fare alcuna cosa onde evitare di combinare pasticci senza rendersene conto. Voglio precisare che uso Firefox da molti anni, anzi da sempre, e ho fatto centinaia di accessi a tale sito senza problemi. A questo punto ho provato l'eliminazione di tutti i dati, (Cookie, Cronologia, ecc. ecc.), ho provato a disinstallare e reinstallare il tutto ma niente. Vista la neccessità di accedere al sito ho provato ad operare con Chrome, ebbene nessun problema nella navigazione interna al sito e nessun lag. Preciso, inoltre, che ho provato più volte in sequenza prima con Firefox e poi con Chrome, (per escludere eventuali rallentamenti dovuti ai server della banca), ma niente da fare, Firefox un disastro, Chrome tutto ok. Con altri siti che ho navigato non ho riscontrato problemi rilevanti, o almeno di quel tipo. Mi sembra evidente che qualcosa deve essere successo con gli ultimi aggiornamenti. Mi dispiacerebbe molto dover lasciare questo browser dopo una vita passata insieme. Grazie

title: [userChrome.css] What exactly causes "navigator-toolbox" to expand even if children are absolute positioned?
content:
Here is current Firefox UI layout for 95.x: https://i.imgur.com/fDeWGc4.png

I'm trying to understand what causes it to expand even when its child `toolbar#nav-var` is set to be positioned absolutely. It no longer should contribute to the parent height or layout yet it still does. My frist thought was it is JS script that calculate the height and sets it however, there are no direct in-line height changes at all.

Here is the test css:

toolbox#navigator-toolbox > toolbar#nav-bar { position: absolute!important; height: 0!important; min-height: 0!important; }

toolbox#navigator-toolbox > toolbar#nav-bar:focus-within, toolbox#navigator-toolbox > toolbar#nav-bar:hover, toolbox#navigator-toolbox > toolbar#nav-bar:focus { position: absolute!important; height: inherit!important; min-height: inherit!important; }

Using CTRL+L shotrcut combination you can force the nav-bar inputbox to be `focused` which sets custom style that reveals it. Since it is positioned absolutely it should not contribute to layout yet when it appears, the render viewport shifts and `toolbox#navigator-toolbox` height automatically increases.

title: Dark mode starts even though it's disabled in Themes
content:
Since upgrading to 95.0, random pages are being displayed in dark mode.

It's a page level problem: the home page of a site like mlb.com displays correctly, but interior pages of that same site don't (example: https://www.mlb.com/news/mlb-all-batting-stance-team).

Oddly, some interior pages of sites are rendering in dark mode while others don't. To continue with the mlb.com example above, here's an interior page that does not come up in dark mode: https://www.mlb.com/news/featured/baseball-road-trip-locations-in-all-50-states-and-ontario

I have disabled the dark mode theme; that doesn't solve the problem.

In Colors, I have set Text to Black. Background is White.

That doesn't solve the problem.

Also in Colors, I've tried all three options listed in "Override the colors specified in the page". None of them fix it.

All of this is on Windows 10, 64 bit, OS build 19043.1348.

FWIW, this problem doesn't happen if I use FF on an IOS device.

It also doesn't happen with any other browsers I test, like Chrome, Edge, or Brave.

How can I eliminate dark mode?

creator: abdulrehmanmoosa23

title: General Browsing
content:
Dear Firefox:

When ever I try to search for a general topic (e.g. apples), I receive the following error message: "The page isn’t redirecting properly

Firefox has detected that the server is redirecting the request for this address in a way that will never complete.

This problem can sometimes be caused by disabling or refusing to accept cookies."

I believe that have enabled cookies but I always receive the same message above. Could you please help me solve this problem? Thanks. ...
creator: ron.kobylnyk

title: Odd text formatting
content:
I'm not sure how to explain the problem except to say that text in emails looks like random line breaks are being inserted inside words.

For the last several months I've had this happening primarily in Gmail messages but also on some websites. I've tried to refresh, I've deleted and removed the APPDATA folder and reinstalled, and removed/disabled all of my extensions and addons, but it's still happening. I've asked some IT staff at my company, no one knows why it's happening. Help?
creator: chelle3

title: Mozilla crashes any time I try to minimize to taskbar; Win 11
